To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the reset option.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.

Blur personlizations are disabled during keyguard view! Only translucent notifications are enabled!

These colors are the ones tinting the blur background. Instead of the normal grey, you can now choose the colors in the way you like. There are three color filters: One used for light backgrounds, one used for dark backgrounds, and one used for light/dark backgrounds. So how are these colors working? \n The answer is simple. As the titles say, the light filter will be used for lighter backgrounds, the dark filter for dark backgrounds, and the mixed filter for backgrounds neither too dark nor too light. These colors are used for both the status bar and recent apps blur backgrounds.
Blur personlizations are disabled during Keyguard view! Only Translucent Notifications are enabled!
